column4: can anyone answer what is probably a pretty simple question for me? Google has failed me so far
on the desk top using another live cd to boot
you might consider cloning any install, and backing up regularly.
wubi is a file in windows easyliy gotten to.
if i reinstall using wubi of a newer version, will i be able to recover all files?
you can only have one wubi, open the wubi folder in in C and pull out what you need.
updates are not available but any media or docs are.
I have only installed wubi as a training exsperience, where are the docs and what are they?
open wubu , open home and then desktop.
cool it can be a challenge. :D
without any details your sort of dead in the water, such as which browser, how much cpu and ram to begin with.
they wont load in any browser, i've tried chrome firefox and epiphany, all are slow if hey load at all. I have 2 gigs ram, I don't recall the CPU specs
can you refresh my memory on how I fixed this last time? That does sound familiar now that you mentioned it
method 2 is what I generally use but method 3 will put it in the kernel line. http://www.ubuntugeek.com/how-to-disable-ipv6-in-ubuntu.html
you can also get FF6 from a ppa I also use the fasterfox addon.
if you modified the kernel run sudo update-grub  then reboot.
